intro: Hieracium scalenum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with serrated, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread aggressively, often forming dense colonies in disturbed soils. Hieracium scalenum is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
